ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style and formatting

rule.name: SingleArgumentMustBeSingleLine
rule.message: Method calls with 0-1 arguments must be formatted on a single line. Unnecessary multi-line formatting is not allowed
rule.description:
Method calls with 0-1 arguments must be formatted on a single line. Unnecessary multi-line formatting for single arguments is not allowed as it reduces readability and wastes vertical space.
This rule does not apply when the argument is a List or Map declaration, as these often require multi-line formatting for readability.
To customize this rule, edit the $maxArgs variable at the beginning of the XPath expression (default: 1). This sets the maximum number of arguments allowed before multi-line formatting is required.
Version: 1.1.0

property.name: xpath
property.value: let $maxArgs := 1 return //MethodCallExpression[ @InputParametersSize <= $maxArgs and @BeginLine != @EndLine and not(.//NewListLiteralExpression) and not(.//NewMapLiteralExpression) ]
